full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 131 of 228 807 LC2VMAX4 Alessi - Direct during your employment with Mr. Epstein? A. I visit Ms. Maxwell's townhome in London. Q. About when was that? A. I cannot tell you exactly what year, but it was also before my departure. Q. Was it sometime when you were still working for Mr. Epstein? A. Of course. Yes. Q. How did you come to visit Ms. Maxwell's home in London? A. She invite us to see her house. Q. For about how long were you there? A. Five minutes. Q. Can you describe what you saw? A. I saw -- I think it was a townhome, two floors. I think the -- the front door was either red, a red front door, and we saw just the living room. And we went upstairs and it was a -- I think it was a bathroom. And we saw her bedroom upstairs. It was a pretty small place. There was not a big structure. Q. What, if any, rules did Ms. Maxwell tell you to follow as an employee of Mr. Epstein's? A. Oh, there were many, many, many rules. Q. What are some that you remember? A. From rules about presentation of the dishes, presentation of the table; there were rules about the way we should be dressed; there were rules about how we are to address SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018004
